02147 void iMeshP_ghostEntInfo(
02148     const iMesh_Instance instance, 
02150     const iMeshP_PartitionHandle partition, 
02152     int* ghost_rules_allocated, 
02154     int* ghost_rules_size, 
02158     int** ghost_type, 
02160     int** bridge_type, 
02162     int** num_layers, 
02164     int* err  
02166 );
02167   /* end group imeshp_ghost */
02169   /* end group imeshp_comm */
02171 
02176 /***************************************************************************/
02191 void iMeshP_loadAll(
02192     iMesh_Instance instance, 
02194     const iMeshP_PartitionHandle partition, 
02196     const iBase_EntitySetHandle entity_set, 
02198     const char* name, 
02200     const char* options, 
02202     int* err, 
02204     int name_len, 
02206     int options_len  
02208 );

02210 /***************************************************************************/
02214 void iMeshP_saveAll(
02215     iMesh_Instance instance, 
02217     const iMeshP_PartitionHandle partition, 
02219     const iBase_EntitySetHandle entity_set, 
02221     const char* name, 
02223     const char* options, 
02225     int* err, 
02227     const int name_len, 
02229     int options_len  
02231 );
02232   /* end group imeshp_file */
02234 
02235 /*
02236 ------------------------------------------------
02237 Major Items left to do:
02238 -  Support for multiple partitions.
02239    We discussed designating a given partition as 
02240    the "active" partition; i.e., the partition that is actually used in 
02241    the distribution of mesh data in distributed memory.  We were concerned 
02242    that when multiple partitions were used, multiple copies of mesh 
02243    entities would be needed to fully support multiple partitions at the 
02244    same time.  Designating one partition as "active" would store data 
02245    with respect to only one partition.
02246 
02247 -  File I/O support.
02248    Need common set of options to allow interoperability.
02249    Support single files, N << P files on P processes, and P files.
02250    Support reading and writing partition information.
02251    Support initial parallel partitioning of serial file data.
02252    Support storing mapping of parts to processes in files.
02253 
02254 ------------------------------------------------
02255 Minor Items left to do:
02256 -  Determine which capabilities need both "getNumX" and "getX" functions.
02257    That is, when would an application need "getNumX" to allocate memory
02258    for "getX" or separately from "getX".  When could we use only "getX"
02259    and return numX as a byproduct.
02260 
02261 -  Determine with functions need "Ent" and "EntArr" versions, or whether
02262    we should adopt only the more general "EntArr" version.
02263 
02264 -  Determine whether to revise iMeshP_createPartition to make it less MPI 
02265    specific.  We don't want to require applications to link with MPI if the 
02266    implementation doesn't require it.  We may define an ITAPS_Comm name 
02267    typedef'ed appropriately.
02268 
02269 -  iMeshP_getOwnerCopy could be achieved by calling iMeshP_getOwnerPart
02270    followed by iMeshP_getCopyOnPart.  Do we want to keep iMeshP_getOwnerCopy?
02271 
02272 -  We could enhance the functions to update tag data from shared 
02273    entities in owner to perform mathematical operations (similar to MPI_SUM).
02274    From Carl:  "getTag*Operate: Again, we haven't got this in serial.  Does 
02275    the existence of such operations imply that we expect to implement 
02276    fields as tags? (Because that wasn't what I was assuming about field 
02277    implementations at all, personally...)  Note that I'm not opposed to 
02278    this sort of global reduction operation, I just wonder whether it'll see 
02279    use outside of field-like situations.  If not, then it should be in 
02280    parallel fields, not parallel mesh, and usage for 
02281    fields-implemented-as-tags should be handled there."
02282 
02283 ------------------------------------------------
02284 Comments and resolved questions:  
02285 
02286 - For now, we will not include an iterator over local (to a
02287   process) parts within a partition.  If it is needed, it can be added
02288   later.
02289 
02290 - Currently, iMesh doesn't have the functionality to get entities or 
02291   entity sets by type and tag in serial.  Should it?  
02292   Many people said it would be useful; others said it could be costly
02293   (in parallel) or numerically difficult (for floating point values).
02294   This issue is an iMesh issue, not a parallel interface issue, so
02295   for this document, the issue is resolved.  The resolution:  If 
02296   iMesh adopts this capability, we will add it to the
02297   parallel interface.
02298 
02299 - We will not include functions that return all entities with 
02300   given characteristics within a partition; the memory use of these
02301   functions can be large.  Instead, we will return entity information
02302   with respect to parts and/or mesh instances.  If the user wants such
02303   info, he should go through the mechanics of gathering it himself so
02304   that he is painfully aware of how much memory he is allocating.
02305   Removed the following global queries:
02306   + All tag names over the partition;
02307   + All entities in this partition having a given type, tag and/or 
02308     tag name.
02309   + All entity sets in this partition having a given
02310     type, tag and/or tag name.
02311 
02312 - We will not include functions that return information about each
02313   part and/or process in a partition.  Such functions limit memory 
02314   scalability for large numbers of parts.  If the user wants such
02315   info, he should go through the mechanics of gathering it himself so
02316   that he is painfully aware of how much memory he is allocating.
02317   Removed the following global queries:
02318   + The number of entities in each part of the partition;
02319   + The number of entity sets in each part of the partition;
02320   + The number of entities with given type, tag, and/or
02321     tag name in each part of the partition;
02322   + The number of entity sets with given type, tag, 
02323     and/or tag name in each part of the partition;
02324   + All tag names in each part of the partition;
02325 
02326 - Part assignments computed with respect to a set of 
02327   entities induce part assignments to adjacent entities in an
02328   implementation-dependent fashion.  That is, if a partition is computed
02329   with respect to regions, queries about ownership of faces and vertices
02330   are valid.
02331 
02332 ------------------------------------------------
02333 Discussed but unresolved questions:
02334 
02335 - We discussed adding functions that give
02336   hints to an implementation about which data mappings the application 
02337   will use, allowing the implementation to pre-compute them if it chooses 
02338   to.  The example discussed was mapping between entities and parts, but 
02339   other examples in iMesh may also exist.
02340 
02341 - We discussed storing in a partition 
02342   information about which "objects" were used in computing the partition.  
02343   These objects can be single entities or groups of entities.
02344   KDD:  Perhaps this capability should be part of the load-balancing service.
02345 
02346 */
02347 
02348 /*--------------------------------*/
02349 /* NOTES FROM BOOTCAMP MARCH 2008 */
02350 /*--------------------------------*/
02351 /*
02352 -  Changed getPartRank to getRankOfPart.  (Carl)
02353 -  Made sure iMeshP_getNumOfTypeAll and iMeshP_getNumOfTopoAll were
02354    documented as collective operations.  (Carl)
02355 -  Changed suffix "Par" to "All".  (Lori)
02356 -  Added iMeshP_testPart() to test status of part handle, returning
02357    LOCAL, REMOTE, or INVALID.  (Mark M, Lori).
02358    6/25/08:  Removed this function since part handles can no longer be remote.
02359    If an application wants to test the validity of a part handle, it can try
02360    to compute its Part ID.
02361 -  Changed iMeshP_addCopyOf and iMeshP_rmvCopyOf back to
02362    iMeshP_addGhostOf and iMeshP_rmvGhostOf.  If we wanted to use these
02363    functions for adding boundary copies, we'd have to include a list of
02364    already existing remote copies in the arguments, as well as
02365    communicate with parts already owning copies to let them know a ghost
02366    copy has been made.  Actually, this raises an interesting question:
02367    does a boundary copy need to know about all ghost copies of it?
02368 -  Change getEntParStatus to getEntStatus.  (Lori)
02369 -  Changed sendEntArrToPartsPar to exchEntArrToPartsAll.  (Lori,Tim)
02370 
02371 
02372 Parts and Processes:
02373 -  Martin argued for consecutive unique Part IDs in addition to or
02374    instead of Part handles.  He will send use cases.   If we decide to
02375    add them back to the interface, we could compute them in
02376    iMeshP_syncPartitionAll rather than in iMeshP_createPart.  That is, an
02377    application couldn't access them until after iMeshP_syncPartitionAll.
02378    6/25/08:  On follow-up, Martin couldn't recall why having consecutive
02379    PartIDs was necessary.  While we all agree they are conceptually nice,
02380    they are difficult to implement and not really necessary.  Part IDs will
02381    be globally unique but not necessarily consecutive.
02382 -  Are part handles globally unique?  They probably need to be
02383    globally unique in order for them to be useful as remote part
02384    handles.  Also, does the process rank need to be encoded in the part
02385    handle in order to map from parts to processes for communication?
02386    6/25/08:  DECIDED:  We will have globally unique part IDs.  Part handles
02387    will be valid for only local parts.  Accessing remote parts must be done
02388    via Part IDs.
02389 -  If in iMeshP_syncPartitionAll, we computed a mapping from part
02390    handles to integers 0,..., k-1, we could store only ranges of
02391    integers to achieve the part-to-process and process-to-parts mappings;
02392    this would require O(P) storage per process for P processes.
02393    6/5/08:  DECIDED:  Do not need getPartOnRank or getNumPartOnRank.  These
02394    functions were troublesome due to their storage or communication 
02395    requirements.  We decided to remove them.
02396 -  Alternatively, the mapping of all parts to processes can be stored
02397    in O(k) total memory, distributed across processors (e.g., a
02398    distributed data directory) but interrogating the directory requires
02399    communication.  
02400    6/5/08:  See note above.
02401 -  iMeshP_getPartsOnRank created discussion and needs to be resolved.
02402    IMeshP_getPartsOnRank would likely require either O(k) storage per
02403    process for k parts or communication.  For other points, please see
02404    Mark M's 3/12/08 email.  
02405    6/5/08:  See note above.
02406 
02407 CreateEnt:
02408 -  Carl asked if we should have a version of createEnt that accepts a
02409    part handle.  Should this function be used only for creating owned
02410    entities?   How do you envision creating part boundary entities when a
02411    parallel mesh is initially loaded?  
02412 
02413 Ghost entities:
02414 -  We currently have a mechanism only for pushing ghosts onto other
02415    parts.  Will we want a mechanism for pulling them, too?  (E.g., a
02416    part says, "I want ghosts for this entity.")
02417 
02418 PartNbor functions:
02419 -  Did we agree to remove the entity type from these functions?  That
02420    is, do we want to return the part IDs for all parts that have
02421    any copies?  The entity type was intended to allow us to get the part
02422    IDs for all parts that have copies of a given type (perhaps
02423    ALL_TYPES).  
02424 
02425 Functions handling both Parts and Entity Sets:
02426 -  Tim said these function names (e.g., iMeshP_getNumOfType,
02427    iMeshP_getAllVtxCoord) are too close to existing iMesh function
02428    names, even though the argument lists would be different.  He agreed
02429    to email suggestions for better names.
02430 
02431 Copies:
02432 -  Functions getNumCopies, getCopies, getCopyParts, and getCopyOnPart
02433    have different behavior for ghost and part-boundary copies.  Ghosts
02434    will return only itself and its owner in getCopies; part-boundary
02435    entities will return copies on other parts as well.
02436 -  Tim envisions applications (e.g., FETI methods) updating tag data
02437    in their copies that they would like to accumulate back to the
02438    owner.  Xiaolin said that he writes in his ghosts, but doesn't send
02439    those values back to the owner.  Currently, we have the ability 
02440    to send tag data only from owners to ghosts.  Tim will look at this issue
02441    and propose a solution.
02442 
02443 Communication:
02444 -  Although we should think in terms of parts, communication really
02445    occurs with respect to processes.  We need to make sure all our
02446    communication routines make sense with respect to both processes and
02447    parts, and perhaps, revise their descriptions.  Also, if we send to
02448    parts, the implementation really does need the mapping of parts to
02449    processes. 
02450 
02451 Entity Owner/Status Queries:
02452 -  Should we combine functions getEntOwnerPart and getEntStatus into
02453    one function?  Or should we combine functions getOwnerCopy and
02454    getEntOwner into one function?  Or should we remove getOwnerCopy and
02455    make applications call getOwnerPart followed by getCopyOnPart?
02456 
02457 Reducing storage:
02458 -  Mark Miller proposed allowing the user to specify the amount of 
02459    copying done by the implementation, depending on applications' needs.
02460    For example, for a static viz application, every boundary entity may not
02461    need to know where all its copies are, so the implementation would not
02462    have to store them.  Can the implementations accept a flag advising them how
02463    much copying is needed?  If so, the implementations could choose to 
02464    optimize storage or ignore the flag.
02465 */
02466
